notice_type: Notice to Quit + Notice of Intention to Seek Possession

notice_to_quit.minimum_period: 4 weeks (28 days) for weekly/monthly tenancies. Period must end on first or last day of tenancy period.
notice_to_quit.notes: Must be in writing. Notice period depends on tenancy type and payment frequency.

notice_of_intention.notes: Must specify grounds and give at least 28 days notice (14 days for grounds 8, 14, 17). Served after or with Notice to Quit.

court_process.timeframe: Hearing typically scheduled 4-8 weeks after claim filed
evidence_requirements: Copy of Notice to Quit served on tenant
Copy of Notice of Intention to Seek Possession
Proof of service of both notices
Electrical Installation Condition Report (EICR) if required

ground_1.title: Owner-Occupier
ground_1.shortDescription: The landlord who let the dwelling-house or any one of joint landlords occupied it as their only or principal home at some time before the beginning of the tenancy and requires it for that purpose again.
ground_1.fullText: Not later than the beginning of the tenancy the landlord gave notice in writing to the tenant that possession might be recovered on this ground. The landlord who let the dwelling-house or any one of joint landlords occupied it (whether or not as his only or principal home) at some time before the beginning of the tenancy and requires it as his or his spouse's or civil partner's only or principal home.
ground_1.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 1, Ground 1
ground_1.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_1.court_decision: Mandatory - court must grant possession if ground proven
required_evidence: Written notice given before/at start of tenancy
Proof landlord requires property as only/principal home
common_defences: No written notice given before tenancy started
Landlord does not genuinely require as only/principal home
ground_1.notes: Pre-tenancy notice requirement is strict. Must genuinely require for occupation.

ground_2.title: Mortgagee Requiring Possession
ground_2.shortDescription: The dwelling-house is subject to a mortgage and the mortgagee requires possession to exercise a power of sale.
ground_2.fullText: Not later than the beginning of the tenancy the landlord gave notice in writing to the tenant that possession might be recovered on this ground. The dwelling-house is subject to a mortgage granted before the beginning of the tenancy and the mortgagee is entitled to exercise a power of sale and requires possession for the purpose of disposing of the dwelling-house with vacant possession.
ground_2.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 1, Ground 2
ground_2.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_2.court_decision: Mandatory - court must grant possession if ground proven
common_defences: Mortgagee not entitled to exercise power of sale
ground_2.notes: Usually granted when property is being repossessed.

ground_8.title: Serious Rent Arrears
ground_8.shortDescription: Both at the date of service of notice and at the date of the hearing, at least 8 weeks' rent is unpaid (or 2 months for monthly tenancy).
ground_8.fullText: Both at the date of the service of the notice of intention to seek possession and at the date of the hearing: (a) if rent is payable weekly or fortnightly, at least 8 weeks' rent is unpaid; (b) if rent is payable monthly, at least 2 months' rent is unpaid; (c) if rent is payable quarterly, at least one quarter's rent is more than 3 months in arrears; (d) if rent is payable yearly, at least 3 months' rent is more than 3 months in arrears.
ground_8.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 1, Ground 8
ground_8.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (14 days minimum for Ground 8)
ground_8.court_decision: Mandatory - court must grant possession if arrears proven
required_evidence: Rent account showing arrears at notice date
Rent account showing arrears at hearing date
Proof of rent amount and payment schedule
common_defences: Arrears not 8 weeks/2 months at both dates
ground_8.notes: Shortened 14-day notice period. Must prove arrears at both notice date AND hearing date.

ground_10.title: Some Rent Arrears
ground_10.shortDescription: Some rent lawfully due from the tenant is unpaid on the date proceedings commenced and was in arrears at the date of service of notice.
ground_10.fullText: Some rent lawfully due from the tenant is unpaid on the date on which proceedings for possession are begun and was in arrears at the date of the service of the notice of intention to seek possession.
ground_10.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 10
ground_10.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_10.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
required_evidence: Proof of rent amount and payment schedule
ground_10.notes: Court will consider reasonableness. Small arrears or payment plan in place may result in suspended order.

ground_11.title: Persistent Delay in Paying Rent
ground_11.shortDescription: Whether or not any rent is in arrears, the tenant has persistently delayed paying rent.
ground_11.fullText: Whether or not any rent is in arrears on the date on which proceedings for possession are begun, the tenant has persistently delayed paying rent which is lawfully due.
ground_11.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 11
ground_11.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_11.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
required_evidence: Rent payment history showing pattern of late payments
Record of due dates vs actual payment dates
Number and frequency of late payments
ground_11.notes: Must show pattern of persistent delays, not just occasional late payment.

ground_12.title: Breach of Tenancy Obligation
ground_12.shortDescription: Any obligation of the tenancy (other than rent payment) has been broken or not performed.
ground_12.fullText: Any obligation of the tenancy (other than one relating to the payment of rent) has been broken or not performed.
ground_12.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 12
ground_12.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_12.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
ground_12.notes: Breach must be material. Court considers whether breach remedied and reasonableness.

ground_13.title: Waste or Neglect
ground_13.shortDescription: The condition of the dwelling-house has deteriorated owing to acts of waste, or neglect by the tenant or person residing with tenant.
ground_13.fullText: The condition of the dwelling-house or any of the common parts has deteriorated owing to acts of waste by, or the neglect or default of, the tenant or any person residing or lodging with the tenant or any sub-tenant of the tenant. If a person lodging with the tenant or a sub-tenant of the tenant is responsible, the tenant has not taken reasonable steps to remove that person.
ground_13.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 13
ground_13.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_13.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
required_evidence: Evidence linking damage to tenant's actions/neglect
common_defences: Deterioration is fair wear and tear
ground_13.notes: Must distinguish from fair wear and tear. Landlord's maintenance obligations still apply.

ground_14.title: Nuisance or Annoyance
ground_14.shortDescription: The tenant or person residing with tenant has been guilty of conduct causing or likely to cause nuisance or annoyance to neighbours or convicted of using property for immoral or illegal purposes.
ground_14.fullText: The tenant or a person residing in or visiting the dwelling-house has been guilty of conduct causing or likely to cause a nuisance or annoyance to a person residing, visiting or otherwise engaging in a lawful activity in the locality, or has been convicted of using the dwelling-house or allowing it to be used for immoral or illegal purposes, or an arrestable offence committed in, or in the locality of, the dwelling-house.
ground_14.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 14
ground_14.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (14 days minimum for Ground 14)
ground_14.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
required_evidence: Incident log with dates and details
ground_14.notes: Shortened 14-day notice period. Court considers severity and whether behaviour continues.

ground_15.title: Deterioration of Furniture
ground_15.shortDescription: The condition of furniture has deteriorated owing to ill-treatment by tenant or person residing with tenant.
ground_15.fullText: The condition of any furniture provided for use under the tenancy has deteriorated owing to ill-treatment by the tenant or any person residing or lodging with the tenant or any sub-tenant of the tenant. If a person lodging with the tenant or a sub-tenant of the tenant is responsible, the tenant has not taken reasonable steps to remove that person.
ground_15.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 15
ground_15.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_15.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
common_defences: Deterioration is fair wear and tear
ground_15.notes: Must be ill-treatment, not fair wear and tear. Only applies to furnished tenancies.

ground_16.title: False Statement
ground_16.shortDescription: The tenancy was granted on the basis of a false statement made knowingly or recklessly by the tenant.
ground_16.fullText: The tenancy was granted (whether or not after 10th April 2007) on the basis of a false statement made knowingly or recklessly by the tenant or a person acting at the tenant's instigation.
ground_16.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 16
ground_16.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (28 days minimum)
ground_16.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
required_evidence: Evidence statement was material to granting tenancy
common_defences: Statement not knowingly or recklessly made
ground_16.notes: False statement must be material - i.e., landlord would not have granted tenancy if true facts known.

ground_17.title: Domestic Violence
ground_17.shortDescription: The tenant was a partner of the landlord and left because of domestic violence.
ground_17.fullText: The landlord was a person who, before the tenancy was granted, was a partner of the tenant and the tenancy was granted for no consideration or a consideration significantly less than market value and the partner who is the landlord has ceased to live with the tenant because of violence or threats of violence by the tenant or a member of the tenant's household.
ground_17.statute: Private Tenancies (Northern Ireland) Order 2006, Schedule 2, Part 2, Ground 17
ground_17.notice_required: Yes - Notice of Intention (14 days minimum for Ground 17)
ground_17.court_decision: Discretionary - court may refuse if not reasonable to evict
required_evidence: Evidence tenancy granted for nil/low consideration
Evidence of domestic violence (police reports, court orders, medical records)
ground_17.notes: Shortened 14-day notice period. Designed to protect victims of domestic violence.

deposit_protection.scheme: Tenancy Deposit Scheme Northern Ireland (TDS NI)
deposit_protection.penalty: Court may order return of deposit or penalty up to 3 times deposit amount
deposit_protection.notes: Only one scheme operates in Northern Ireland. Must protect deposit and provide prescribed information.

gas_safety.notes: Must provide copy to tenant within 28 days

epc.notes: From 1 April 2025, cannot let property with EPC rating below E

eicr.notes: Electrical Installation Condition Report required from 1 April 2025

fit_for_habitation.description: Property must be fit for human habitation at start and throughout tenancy
fit_for_habitation.enforcement: Environmental Health, Tenant can sue landlord
key_requirements: Free from dampness prejudicial to health
Adequate facilities for cooking and washing

hmo_licensing.required_if: Property is a House in Multiple Occupation
hmo_licensing.definition: Building occupied by 3 or more people from more than 1 household sharing facilities
hmo_licensing.notes: HMO license required before letting. Standards enforced by Environmental Health.

landlord_registration.notes: No landlord registration scheme in Northern Ireland (unlike Scotland or Wales)
